name: Variety Pack Alpha
ideas: Develop a choose-your-own-adventure with a difficulty setting based on pet obstacles.
Recreate the sounds of different eras of technology from dial-up to smartphone notifications. A audio history lesson.
Establish an undercover operation among your bathroom products. The shampoo has been there too long.
Write a performance review for your taste buds, noting their changing preferences.
Develop your range of expressions for when someone shows you photos of their vacation. Interest is key.
Lead an archaeological dig through your old email inbox. Ancient embarrassments await discovery.
Build a tiny carnival for ants complete with a Ferris wheel made from a CD and toothpicks.
Hold a trial for the autocorrect that changed your perfectly clear message to nonsense.
Draft a peace treaty between your left and right feet. They've been stepping on each other's territory for too long.
Hold a moment of silence for all the clever comebacks you thought of too late. Gone but not forgotten.
Create a class action lawsuit representing all victims of unexpectedly empty ice cream containers.
Lead an expedition through the treacherous terrain of your closet. Many socks have entered, few have returned as matching pairs.
Perform ceiling staring commentary in multiple languages for international audiences.
Compose a passive-aggressive note to yourself about dishes in the sink, then ignore it.
Write a memoir from the perspective of a raindrop that landed on your window. Its journey was epic and underappreciated.
Document the rise and fall of the Great Junk Drawer Empire through interpretive drawer slamming and dramatic narration.
Construct complete mythologies around why your phone charger only works in one specific outlet.
Develop a speed run challenge for finding and preparing a midnight snack.
Perform a pet language job interview, determining if they qualify for pets positions.
Conduct a thorough review of your own walking style, rating each foot on technique and commitment.
Develop different ceiling staring venues and rate their ceilings for competition worthiness.
Create a radio book club discussing whatever you're currently reading to no one.
Submit your sleeping habits for formal academic peer review. Results: inconclusive but concerning.
Hold a mock trial for the scissors that are never where you left them. Seek the truth.
Write a constitution for the Republic of Under the Bed, establishing blanket fort rights.
Perform shadow puppet tutorials on how to spot government surveillance in your household shadows. Trust no lamp.
Critique each doorknob in your home on its turning satisfaction and overall aesthetic contribution.
Host a beauty pageant for your groceries, complete with talent and interview portions. The eggplant is surprisingly articulate.
Build a monument using stacked books you've been meaning to read.
Compose a passive-aggressive note from your plants about your inconsistent watering schedule.
Develop a detailed extended universe for the objects in your medicine cabinet. The expired Tylenol has stories.
Consider deeply whether time flies or we fly through time. It's a matter of perspective.
Write a linguistics paper analyzing the regional dialects between indoor and outdoor pets.
Perform a classical music appreciation show, humming all the pieces yourself.
Create a rating system for different types of silence when someone asks who ate the last cookie.
Write a horror story from your reflection's perspective about the terrifying world outside the mirror.
Take an imaginary vacation to the land behind your couch. Document the strange artifacts and dust bunny civilizations you discover.
Create a speed run of an entire productive day from waking to sleeping.
Perform the complete audio for a romantic comedy using only your voice and some paper to rustle dramatically.
Create a sock puppet ceasefire agreement between the static-cling combatants.
Create a monument out of empty snack wrappers from your procrastination sessions.
Draft a formal apology to your houseplants for all the times you forgot to water them. They deserved better.
Organize an official ceiling staring championship with weight classes based on how long you can go.
Philosophize about whether mirrors show us as we are or as we think we are. Identity crisis incoming.
Create a ballet about the grace and tragedy of dropping something and it rolling under the couch.
Conduct a formal ceremony to honor the charging cable that's been with you since two phones ago.
Explore the ancient civilization that exists behind your washer and dryer. Lost socks thrive there.
Develop a detailed backstory for the mystery key on your keychain that opens absolutely nothing you know of.
Host a competitive league for timing how long you can hold your breath while walking past strangers.
Organize a graduation ceremony for expired gift cards who have completed their worthless journey.
Recreate the audio of a video game using only vocal sounds. Your power-up noise should be inspiring.
Perform a trial where you prosecute your own procrastination for crimes against productivity.
Create a morning radio show persona and broadcast to your empty kitchen with traffic updates.
Perform a speed run of tidying a room with glitch exploitation (shoving things in drawers counts).
Write a pet language romance novel with dialogue in the original pet with subtitles.
Build a tiny observatory for imaginary astronomers using toilet paper tubes. Tonight they'll discover a new ceiling constellation.
Deliver a rousing speech accepting the award for most creative excuse for not exercising.
Recruit your spare change as a network of spies embedded in various coat pockets and couch cushions.
Write an emotional thank-you speech for your pillow, acknowledging all the nights it absorbed your drool without complaint.
Perform sound effects for someone else's live actions as they go about their day. They're now in an action movie.
Perform a tool-assisted speed run attempt at folding laundry. Humans can do better.
Create a sound effect dictionary with demonstrations for at least 50 different sounds. Become the human sound board.
Map the unexplored frontiers inside your backpack's smallest pocket. Civilizations of crumbs thrive there.
Develop a psychological evaluation of the light switch that's been flickering suspiciously.
Develop a cooking show on radio, describing everything in unnecessary detail.
Write the official history of the pen cup on your desk, including the civil war between markers and pens.
Perform a radio technology show reviewing the appliances in your home.
Perform sock puppet election monitoring for the democratic sock drawer elections.
Start a petition demanding that clouds submit formal applications before blocking the sun. Establish an approval committee.
Write a peace treaty between Sunday evening and Monday morning. The transition needs to be gentler.
Provide documentary coverage of your houseplant's dramatic journey toward the window for light.
Compose a formal letter to Future You, warning them about that weird smell in the fridge you're choosing to ignore today.
Create a soap opera about the dramatic lives of weather patterns. The cold front is having an affair with the warm front.
Write the tragic origin story of the pen that ran out of ink mid-signature. It died a hero.
Rate your various sneezes on volume, satisfaction, and the number of 'bless yous' they receive.
Write a ceiling staring autobiography as a veteran of the sport reflecting on your career.
Organize a graduation ceremony for your oldest pair of shoes. They've walked many miles with you.
Develop a statue representing the human spirit of 'maybe later.'
Create a pet language news broadcast reporting on important pet current events.
Develop an in-depth conspiracy theory about why the refrigerator hums when no one is watching.
Draft a treaty between your body and your brain about reasonable bedtime expectations. Terms are still being negotiated.
Present your findings on the aerodynamics of the blanket-to-bed ratio for optimal temperature.
Create a furniture constellation map, arranging pieces to match star patterns visible tonight.
Narrate your refrigerator's contents like a nature documentary. The leftover pizza is the apex predator of the middle shelf ecosystem.
Choreograph a ballet that expresses the emotional journey of waiting for the microwave.
Perform a skills assessment for your fingers, evaluating typing speed and dexterity.
Write a Yelp review for your shower's water pressure. Be brutally honest about its inconsistent temperature policies.
Narrate your search for the TV remote like an increasingly desperate survival documentary. Day three: hope fades.
Create a diorama depicting the moment you decided to start something 'tomorrow.'
Create a performance improvement plan for your stubborn left foot.
Deploy your various hair ties as intelligence agents. Most of them have already gone rogue.
Write a formally peer-reviewed study on why 'just five more minutes' is always a lie.
Organize an official retirement ceremony for the umbrella that's been sitting unopened for three years.
Create a conspiracy board with string connecting all suspicious appliance activities.
Perform a dramatic reading while facing your reflection, seeing who can be more expressive.
Create a weather warning system for when your significant other is in a mood. Develop appropriate icons and alert levels.
Record yourself recreating famous movie sound effects and compare to the originals. The Jaws theme is just two notes.
Create a reality TV show where leftovers compete to avoid being thrown out. Vote for your favorite container of mystery food.
Host a medal ceremony for the oldest items in your pantry. They've survived multiple kitchen cleanings.
Build a shrine to your most impressive procrastination achievement. The delay was legendary.
Write branching paths based on whether you turn left or right around the couch.
Chronicle the epic tale of how that one weird smell in your garage has evolved over time.
Write detailed restaurant-style reviews for each of the leftovers currently in your fridge. The pasta shows promise.
Perform scientific experiments to test the limits of mirror dimension physics. Why is everything backwards?
Write an emotional farewell letter to your patience before logging onto social media.
Host a competitive bracket for ranking your most impressive feats of laziness. The winner takes a nap.
Organize an official medal ceremony for the sock that survived the washing machine with no partner.
Perform furniture speed dating, rapidly trying different arrangements to find 'the one.'
Host a staring contest with objects around your house. The wall is undefeated and slightly smug about it.
Write an emotional hall of fame speech for the pan that's outlasted three relationships.
Establish your collection of twist ties as a covert resistance movement against bread bag entropy.
Have a philosophical debate with yourself about whether a hot dog is a sandwich. Present arguments from both the pro and anti factions.
Write a stirring nomination speech for your vacuum cleaner to join the appliance hall of fame. It sucks, in the best way.
Build a triumphal arch celebrating successfully putting things off.
Organize formal retirement proceedings for your oldest pair of underwear. Thank them for their service.
Pretend you're a spy whose mission is to make a sandwich without alerting the sleeping cat. Failure is not an option.
Develop shadow puppet soap operas about the dramatic relationships between different objects' shadows.
Create sock puppet ambassador profiles, complete with diplomatic credentials and policy positions.
Create a wellness initiative for overworked body parts needing better work-life balance.
Construct a scale model of Stonehenge using TV remotes. Ancient druids would definitely approve of your channel-changing monument.
Perform sock puppet hostage negotiations when the dryer takes sock prisoners.
Host a series of matches pitting different ice cubes against each other in melting competitions.
Develop a mirror dimension news broadcast, reporting on events happening in reverse-world.
Write a ransom note to the weekend demanding it last longer or consequences will follow.
Create a courtroom drama prosecuting the sidewalk crack that made you trip.
Create a rating system for the emotional impact of different types of weather on your desire to do anything.
Create a governmental structure for the Bathroom Province, addressing shower time equality.
Host a speed-stacking competition using whatever's already on your counter. The spice jars versus the canned goods.
Build miniature skate parks for insects using cardboard and tape. Watch the ants shred.
Assign your loose coins as double agents working between your car and your couch. Trust no cent.
Develop a sock puppet human rights council investigating conditions in the back of the drawer.
Write a formal peace treaty between your desire to stay up late and your need to wake up early.
Develop a radio documentary series investigating interesting household phenomena.
Compose your speech for receiving an award for 'Most Hours Spent Watching Shows You Weren't Really Into.'
Accept your award for excellence in the field of standing in front of the fridge hoping something inspires you.
Stage a funeral for a dead battery with full honors. It powered through so much before its final discharge.
Create the comprehensive mythology of the mysterious dripping sound you sometimes hear at night.
Recruit your shoes as double agents in a complex spy network. The left sneaker's loyalty is questionable at best.
Author a heartfelt plea to manufacturers about why twist ties should be more intuitive.
Perform closing arguments in the case against the ice cube that didn't release from the tray.
Build a tiny highway system for toy cars using tape on your floor. Traffic laws strictly enforced.
Provide play-by-play coverage of your attempt to find the end of the packing tape. It's hidden well.
Create a interpretive movement piece about the journey of a text message left on read.
Assign code names to all your furniture and conduct covert operations between them.
Write your speech for receiving a lifetime achievement award in overthinking simple decisions.
Develop an interpretive dance about the politics of sharing an armrest.
Develop an extended cinematic universe for the stray buttons in your sewing kit. Drama awaits.
Create elaborate backstories for every car you can see from your window. Each has a name and dreams.
Create a pet language meditation guide for relaxation in their native tongue.
Write a memoir from your laptop's perspective about everything it's witnessed while open. The secrets it could tell.
Create a horror story from your phone's perspective about low battery situations. The true terror of 1% remaining.
Develop a sock puppet NATO equivalent, the North Ankle Treaty Organization, for collective sock security.
Provide running commentary on yourself trying to open a stubborn jar lid. The struggle is real and riveting.
Perform an exposé about the microwave's suspicious knowledge of exactly when you're watching it.
Explore the ancient ruins of the box of stuff you never unpacked when you moved in. Treasures await.
Preside over a formal sendoff for the last roll of the toilet paper you forgot to replace.
Develop a parliamentary system for a multi-pet household animal nation.
Write a glowing review for your liver, acknowledging its thankless work.
Build tiny ski slopes for your fingernails using tissue boxes. The black diamond runs are treacherous.
Create shadow puppet propaganda from different shadow factions vying for wall space dominance.
Perform a radio mystery series with cliffhangers between episodes.
Record yourself attempting to make the Wilhelm Scream. Compare to the original. Repeat until perfect.
Argue passionately about whether 11:59 AM or 12:01 PM is the true start of afternoon. This debate has raged for generations.
Practice your response to 'tell me a fun fact about yourself' until it doesn't sound rehearsed. It always will.
Wonder deeply about whether plants are judging your lifestyle choices. They seem judgmental.
Write a strongly-worded letter to the wind demanding it stop messing up your hair. Include photographic evidence of past offenses.
Practice your reaction for when someone spoils a show you weren't even watching. Betrayal must be conveyed precisely.
Write a peer-reviewed paper on the optimal method for arranging pillows you'll just push aside anyway.
Write love letters from your phone to its charger, expressing gratitude for their nightly connection. It's romantic.
Write a formal complaint to February about its inconsistent length. Pick a lane, February.
Develop a commemorative coin collection celebrating major procrastination milestones.
Perform diplomatic negotiations between your sleep schedule and your calendar commitments.
Write a constitution establishing the separation of nap time and work time.
Construct miniature ski lifts for cotton balls using dental floss and popsicle sticks. Bunny hill opens at noon.
Write your remarks for being inducted into the hall of fame for snooze button expertise.
Write a coming-of-age story about a USB cable figuring out which way it goes in. The struggle of every insertion.
Develop a conspiracy theory about why your dryer is secretly hoarding socks for unknown purposes.
Explore the mysterious depths of your coat pockets from last winter. Treasures and old receipts await.
Write fan fiction about the romance between a summer breeze and an autumn wind. Their love is forbidden by the seasons.
Create employee of the month recognition for your most reliable body part.
Perform a furniture intervention, addressing pieces that aren't living up to their potential in their current spots.
Draft environmental protection laws for the Nation of House Plants.
Perform ceiling staring with dramatic musical accompaniment to enhance the experience.
Host a ceremony to officially name the random corner where you always pile stuff temporarily.
Practice your acceptance speech for winning the 'Best Excuse for Not Returning a Text Right Away' award.
Perform a trial where April is accused of cruel jokes. Its pranks have gone too far.
Introduce to market: shoes that make different cartoon sound effects with each step. Finally, walking is entertaining.
Develop a fitness program done entirely with your reflection. Synchronized mirror workouts.
Host an intervention for your relationship with that one song you've listened to 400 times.
Host an intervention for the plant that's been barely surviving on your windowsill. It's time to talk.
Create a dance that captures the emotional weight of untangling headphone cords.
Draft an alliance proposal between you and your future self about not eating all the snacks tonight.
Write a whistleblower account from a defecting appliance about the machines' true agenda.
Create ceiling staring fantasy leagues where you draft different ceilings for your team.
Create a shadow puppet thriller about the secret meetings happening in the dark corners of your room.
Create a nature documentary about the wild ecosystem inside your refrigerator. Observe the cheese in its natural habitat.
Perform an exposé on the vacuum cleaner's questionable relationship with your allergies.
Develop shadow puppet political debates between the shadows of household items. The lamp shadow has strong opinions.
Create shadow puppet educational content about the physics of shadows, with conspiracy theory tangents.
Create an eating competition where you race yourself to finish a snack. You always win, but also always lose.
